source.7bac4c51:
You will be creating a unit converter. Your finished program should have output like this:

```
How many inches? 45
45 inches is 3 feet and 8 inches
```

Your task:
1.   Ask the user for a number of inches (it will be an integer)
2.  Convert the number of inches into feet and inches, as above

Want to make it better? You could...
* fix the grammar if three is only one inch
*   Allow users to enter decimals
*   Allow users to choose different measurements (45 inches is how many meters?)
*   Anything else you can think of!
source.ee0d445d:
Requirement Description Points Earned
Originality All code is your own. Any code snippets that are not your own are properly cited. No more than 5 lines from any website. 15 points
Planning & Reflection The "make a plan" section includes a detailed description of how you plan to complete the project. Reflection is thoughtful and answers all required questions. 15 points
Compiles Code Compiles 10 points
Comments Code is properly commented 10 points
Conventions Naming and style conventions are approriate 10 points
Size/ Complexity Your story must be at least 5 sentences and ask for at least 5 pieces of user input 10 points
Variables Each piece of user input is stored as a variable. At least one variable is an int or a float. 15 points
Print At the end, the story is printed with user input 15 points

source.ee695855:
Here, write a 1 paragraph reflection answering the following questions:

*   What was the hardest part of this project?
*   What was the easiesy part of this project?
*   How did you utilize your peer feedback?
* What was different between your plan and the final project?
* How well did you plan? Was your idea too easy? Too hard? Just right?
* If you had unlimited time, what would you add to this project?
